ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:0.5_0: 21. The training rule on arms akimbo
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were walking in inhabited areas with arms akimbo. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not walk in inhabited areas with arms akimbo,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.4_0: One should not walk in an inhabited area with arms akimbo.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, walks in an inhabited area with one or both arms akimbo, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.7.1_0: or it has not been trusted ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.9_0: The first rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
